item.title: Kachaudi Gali: A Culinary Heritage of Varanasi
item.description:
In the heart of ancient Varanasi, where narrow lanes tell stories of centuries past, lies the famous Kachaudi Gali - a testament to the city’s rich culinary heritage. This historic lane, nestled in the bustling old city, has been serving the city’s favorite breakfast for over 150 years.

Historical Significance

The origins of Kachaudi Gali can be traced back to the late 19th century when the first shops were established by traditional halwais (confectioners). The lane got its name from its signature dish - the kachaudi, a crispy, spicy deep-fried pastry filled with a mixture of ground lentils and aromatic spices. Legend has it that the recipe was perfected by local cooks who served the nobility during the British era.

item.title: About Kachaudi Gali
item.description:
About Kachaudi Gali

Kachaudi Gali is more than just a food blog - it’s a celebration of India’s rich street food culture. Our mission is to:

  1. Document and preserve traditional street food recipes
  2. Share authentic food experiences from across India
  3. Connect food lovers with the best street food spots
  4. Promote the diverse culinary heritage of Indian street food

Our Story

Founded by food enthusiasts who believe in the power of street food to bring people together, Kachaudi Gali aims to be your trusted companion in exploring the vibrant world of Indian street cuisine.
